eval.py

This is the module that evaluates the model.

Checks the Evaluator parameters.

class Evaluator(params)[source]

Bases: object

Evaluates the model.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

classes = {}

class list

  • key=opt: optimizer method class

  • key=loss: loss function class

  • key=metrics: list of metrics classes

Type:

ClassVar[dict[str, Any]]

model

model class

Type:

Callable

callbacks

list of callback classes

Type:

list[Callable]

load_dataset()[source]

Loads the evaluation data.

setup()[source]

Sets up the evaluation.

  • Sets the loss function, model, metrics.

  • Set the model weights.

  • Run .summary().

run()[source]

Runs evaluation.

  • Run .compile().

  • Customize the evaluation of your trained models.

main(params)[source]

main.

This function is decorated by @save_params_log and @process_time.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

Returns:

dict[str, Any] – parameters.

set_params()[source]

Sets the command line arguments and file parameters.

  • Set only common parameters as command line arguments.

  • Other necessary parameters are set in the file parameters.

  • Use a yaml file. (lib.common.file.load_yaml())

Returns:

dict[str, Any] – parameters.

Attention

Command line arguments are overridden by file parameters. This means that if you want to set everything using file parameters, you don’t necessarily need to use command line arguments.
